articles.title: How Cocaine Hijacks the Brain - Neuroscience News
articles.summary: FeaturedGeneticsNeuroscience·June 2, 2025 Summary: In a groundbreaking study, researchers have engineered fruit flies that voluntarily consume cocaine, creating the first fly model for cocaine addiction. Typically, flies avoid the drug due to its bitter taste, but by disabling their bitter-sensing receptors, scientists encouraged addictive behavior within just 16 hours of exposure. This model is a major step toward rapidly testing...
